author: Special Correspondent
text:
Say mixers, grinders distributed are defective

Congress Members of the Legislative Assembly breaking mixers and grinders that were distributed by the All India N.R. Congress government, in front of the Puducherry Legislative Assembly campus on Thursday, alleging they were of substandard quality —Photo: M. Samraj

Congress Members of the Legislative Assembly on Thursday broke mixers and grinders distributed by the All India N.R. Congress (AINRC) government in front of the Puducherry Legislative Assembly, alleging they were of substandard quality.

After staging a walkout from the Assembly, Leader of Opposition V. Vaithilingam, A. Namassivayam, K. Lakshminarayanan, E. Valsaraj and Malladi Krishna Rao went to the stairs that lead to the Assembly hall. Congress supporters brought a mixer and a grinder to the spot despite tight security.

Mr. Lakshminarayanan swung the machines, dropped and broke them. Later, other MLAs repeated the act for photographers.

Allege poor quality

They alleged that the government distributed substandard products to the public.

Mr. Lakshminarayanan said, “There are a lot of complaints on mixers and grinders supplied to cardholders free. Some of them are not in usable condition. People complain of abnormal noise from the machines when they were switched on.”

The MLAs also alleged that there was no proper system while procuring the machines.
title: Congress MLAs damage freebies
